content.title: Intro
content.content:
1945
Preceded by
1945
1946
Year
1947
Followed by
1947

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1946.

content.title: February
content.content:
10 - John Tolkien becomes a priest.
21 - Anthony Daniels, who would play Legolas in The Lord of the Rings (1978 film), is born.

content.title: April
content.content:
14 - The review "Research v. Literature" by J.R.R. Tolkien is published.
29 - Humphrey Carpenter, Tolkien's biographer, is born.

content.title: May
content.content: 1 - Nellie Bellflower, who would play Éowyn in The Return of the King (1980 film), is born in Phoenix, Arizona.

content.title: June
content.content:
1 - Actor Brian Cox is born.
5 - John Bach, who would play Madril in The Lord of the Rings (film series), is born.

content.title: July
content.content:
7 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a postcard to G.E. Selby.
21 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 105.
23 - Philologist G.H. Cowling dies.

content.title: August
content.content: 2 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Przemyslaw Mroczkowski.

content.title: October
content.content:
16 - Percy Bates dies.
18 - Composer Howard Shore is born.

content.title: November
content.content: 4 - John Callen, who would play Óin in The Hobbit (film series), is born.

content.title: Other
content.content:
? - J.R.R. Tolkien works on the Adûnaic language.
Years
1943 1944 1945 1946 1947 1948 1949
